bill_title: revise certain provisions related to the direction, supervision, and registration fees for veterinary technicians.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain requirements related to the registration and authorized activities of veterinary technicians. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 36-12-21.1 be amended to read as follows: 36-12-21.1. Any veterinarian licensed to practice his profession veterinary medicine in the State of South Dakota may use the services of not more than two one or more registered veterinary technicians. Veterinary technicians provided for in this section before being employed by a licensed veterinarian shall be registered by the board as provided by §§ 36-12-21.3 and 36- 12-21.4 and while registered and employed by a licensed veterinarian may No person may perform any duties or services as a veterinary technician unless the person is registered by the State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners as provided in § § 36-12-21.3 and 36-12-21.4 and unless the person is employed by a licensed veterinarian or is supervised by a licensed veterinarian who is employed by the same entity that employs the veterinary technician. A person who is registered and employed as a veterinary technician is not be considered to be engaged in the practice of veterinary medicine. Section 2. That § 36-12-21.3 be amended to read as follows: 36-12-21.3. An application for registry of Any person who desires to be registered as a veterinary technician shall be filed file an application with the board by the licensed veterinarian under whom the technician will practice State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners . The application for registry shall set out the qualifications of the technician required by the rules of the board and the application shall be on forms provided by the board. The fee for registration of a veterinary technician is ten dollars and the shall be established by the board in rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26 and may not exceed fifty dollars. The fee shall accompany the application. Section 3. That § 36-12-21.4 be amended to read as follows: 36-12-21.4. The board State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners shall issue a registration certificate for each veterinary technician registered with the board. The certificate shall state the name of the licensed veterinarian by whom such registered veterinary technician is employed and the year of registration. The registration certificate shall be posted in the office of the licensed veterinarian by whom the veterinary technician is employed or supervised . Section 4. That § 36-12-21.6 be amended to read as follows: 36-12-21.6. A veterinary technician may only work as a veterinary technician only under the direction or supervision of the a licensed veterinarian or licensed veterinarians by whom he the technician is employed or who supervise the technician as provided in § 36-12-21.1 . Section 5. That § 36-12-21.7 be amended to read as follows: 36-12-21.7. A veterinary technician registered under §§ 36-12-21.3 and 36-12-21.4 may not maintain or operate any office separate from the office of the licensed veterinarian or entity by whom he the technician is employed.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions related to the direction, supervision, and registration fees for veterinary technicians. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 36-12-21.1 be amended to read as follows: 36-12-21.1. Any veterinarian licensed to practice his profession veterinary medicine in the State of South Dakota may use the services of not more than two one or more registered veterinary technicians. Veterinary technicians provided for in this section before being employed by a licensed veterinarian shall be registered by the board as provided by §§ 36-12-21.3 and 36- 12-21.4 and while registered and employed by a licensed veterinarian may not be are not considered to be engaged in the practice of veterinary medicine. Section 2. That § 36-12-21.3 be amended to read as follows: 36-12-21.3. An application for registry of a veterinary technician shall be filed with the board by the licensed veterinarian under whom the technician will practice. The application for registry shall set out the qualifications of the technician required by the rules of the board and the application shall be on forms provided by the board. The fee for registration of a veterinary technician is ten dollars and the shall be established by the State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners in rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26 and may not exceed fifty dollars. The fee shall accompany the application. Section 3. That § 36-12-21.6 be amended to read as follows: 36-12-21.6. A veterinary technician may only work under the direction or supervision of the licensed veterinarian or veterinarians by whom he the technician is employed. The State board of Veterinary Medical Examiners shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to define the terms direction and supervision. Section 4. That § 36-12-21.7 be amended to read as follows: 36-12-21.7. A veterinary technician registered under §§ 36-12-21.3 and 36-12-21.4 may not maintain or operate any office separate from the office of the licensed veterinarian by whom he the technician is employed.
